Platform.Title: Custom Agilent Escherichia coli 4 x 44k Gene Expression Array
Platform.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. MG1655
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: Please refer to the manufacturer's web site at http://www.agilent.com/

Sample.Title: Wild-type Cells Replicate 1

Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. MG1655
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: At OD600~0.3, serine hydroxamate was added to a final concentration of 0.5mg/ml, cells were collected 40 minutes later.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Cells were grown in M9 medium supplemented with 0.2% glucose and 0.4% casamino acid at 37℃
Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA was extracted using QIAGEN RNeasy Mini Kit following manufacturer's instructions.
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: 15 µg of RNA were primed with 2.5 µg of random hexamer at 70°C for 10 min, and reversed transcribed at 50°C for 1 h in the presence of 300 U SuperScript III RTase (Invitrogen), 5xRT Buffer, 10mM DTT, 20U RNaseOut (Invitrogen) and 500 µM each dATP, dCTP, dGTP, with 200 µM dTTP, 600 µM aa-dUTP. cDNA samples were incubated with Cy3 (reference) or Cy5 (sample) for 2hrs.

Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. MG1655
Channel.Characteristics: MG1655 delta lac + MG1655 delta lac delta dksA
Pooled RNA from mixture of the same amount of wt, wt+SHX, dksA, dksA+SHX RNA samples
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: At OD600~0.3, serine hydroxamate was added to a final concentration of 0.5mg/ml, cells were collected 40 minutes later.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Cells were grown in M9 medium supplemented with 0.2% glucose and 0.4% casamino acid at 37℃
Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA was extracted using QIAGEN RNeasy Mini Kit following manufacturer's instructions.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 15 µg of RNA were primed with 2.5 µg of random hexamer at 70°C for 10 min, and reversed transcribed at 50°C for 1 h in the presence of 300 U SuperScript III RTase (Invitrogen), 5xRT Buffer, 10mM DTT, 20U RNaseOut (Invitrogen) and 500 µM each dATP, dCTP, dGTP, with 200 µM dTTP, 600 µM aa-dUTP. cDNA samples were incubated with Cy3 (reference) or Cy5 (sample) for 2hrs.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization was performed following Agilent Two-Color Microarray-Based Prokaryote Analysis Protocol.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Scanned on a GenePix 4000B Scanner (Axon Instruments).
Sample.Description: Biological replicate 1 of 3. MG1655 delta lac cells untreated
Sample.Data-Processing: GenePix Pro (v 6.1) was used for background subtraction and normalization.

Series.Title: Expression profiling of E.coli K-12 wild-type vs. delta dksA cells upon amino acid starvation
Series.Summary: Actively dividing cells perform robust and accurate DNA replication during fluctuating nutrient availability, yet factors that prevent disruption of replication remain largely unknown. Here we report that DksA, a nutrient-responsive transcription factor, ensures replication completion in Escherichia coli. In the absence of DksA, replication is rapidly arrested upon amino acid starvation. This replication arrest occurs independently of exogenous DNA damage, yet it induces the DNA damage response and recruits the main recombination protein RecA. This microarray experiment compares the transcriptional responses to amino acid starvation in wild-type and delta dksA cells. The SOS-regulated genes are highly induced in delta dksA cells.
Series.Overall-Design: Four-condition experiment: wt, wt+SHX, delta dksA, delta dksA+SHX. Biological replicates: 3 for each sample. Reference: a mixture of the same amount of the four RNA samples.
